intro: Isodon plectranthoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved skullcap, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its small, tubular flowers are usually purple or blue, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the stems. Isodon plectranthoides is valued for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional Chinese medicine.
